title: Amy Schumer gives Gene 'a million kisses'... after 'crying for days' when returning to work
text:
She revealed earlier in the month that she 'cried a couple of days' when she first went back to work when her son Gene Attell Fischer was just three-months-old.

And Amy Schumer shared an adorable video with her newborn when he was visiting her on set on Monday. The 38-year-old I Feel Pretty actress was seen holding up the happy baby and smothering him with kisses.

The star has two new projects: The Humans with Beanie Feldstein and the TV series Love, Beth.

Mother's love: Amy Schumer couldn't help but smother her five-month-old son, Gene, on Monday when he visited her on set

'Set visit for a million kisses,' she said on social media.

Amy was dressed in a grey long-sleeved top and couldn't help but smile for the surprise visit.

The new mom also revealed during the video that a nickname she used for her son was Ziggy.

Happy days: Amy was dressed in a grey long-sleeved top and couldn't help but smile for the surprise visit

Her little Ziggy! The new mom also revealed during the video that a nickname she used for her son was Ziggy

And it wasn't long until fans and celebrities gushed over the new mom and five-month-old in the comments.

'He's so precious,' wrote friend and mom-to-be Ashley Graham.

Snooki added: 'Omg squishy,' while Savannah Guthrie added: 'I need to hold Gene right this minute.'

Amy's sweet video comes after she shared a heartwarming post about five-months of motherhood on October 5.

'5 months today and like all moms I love him so much it hurts,' she began.

Adorable: And it wasn't long until fans and celebrities gushed over the new mom and five-month-old in the comments

'Im feeling strong and good and like I’m still a human being with interests and ambitions and goals I’m excited to reach.'

She added: 'It’s felt good to be back at work. I was so worried about it and was afraid to go back after he was 3 months old. A couple days I’ve cried from missing him.

'But it’s mostly good to be back and the breaks energize me to be a better mom and appreciate our time even more.'

She completed the post with: 'I have it a lot easier than many people but I wanted to share my experience. what was your going back to work experience?'

Not all easy: Amy previously confessed she 'cried for days' when first returning to work

Understanding: Debra Messing understood Amy's pain and shared her own story of when she had to do it with her son Roman in 2004

Amy was once again inundated with comments and received over 737K likes.

Debra Messing was one of the stars to pen her experiences with going back to work following the birth of her son, Roman Walker Zelman, now 14, in 2004.

'I went back to W&G [Will & Grace] but was lucky I could bring him everyday so every bathroom break I’d hold him and I was able to breastfeed,' began.

'But on show night? Omg, my body hurt from his absence. I felt a physical yearning, and I questioned myself, and felt guilty, and would cry. It was hard.'

Omg, my body hurt from his absence. I felt a physical yearning, and I questioned myself, and felt guilty, and would cry. It was hard' (Debra and Roman in April)

Cheering her on: Fellow moms such as Jessica Seinfeld, Krysten Ritter and Christy Thurlington gave Amy support

'I’d feel such moments of joy making people laugh. I’d get lost in the work and it energized me and empowered me. And then I’d get home and literally sprint to his crib and rock him, feeling like I was HOME.'

She continued: 'It’s hard, being a working mom. But I believe that we are better mom’s when we are able to do what fulfills us. One hour at a time, Amy. ❤️'

Amy welcomed Gene with her chef husband Chris Fischer, 39, in May 2019.

The comedian was candid with her 9.3 million social media followers throughout her pregnancy, particularly sharing her health issues as a result of hyperemesis gravidarum, severe and ongoing morning sickness.

The Duchess Of Cambridge dealt with hyperemesis gravidarum during each of her three pregnancies, increasing public awareness of the condition.
description:
Amy Schumer couldn't help but smother her five-month-old son, Gene, on Monday when he visited her on set. 
The new mom gave the little one 'a million kisses' during his appearance.
